article.title: The government of the American Public Library
article.author: Joeckel, C.B.
article.text: The major purpose of this study is to describe, analyze, and evaluate the position of the public library in the structure of government in the United States. The use of the word "government" in the title, therefore, is deliberate. We are here concerned with the legal forms and types of governmental organization of the public library and with its relation to the city or other political unit to which it is attached or which it serves.
